properties.areaDesc: Western Columbia River Gorge; Western Columbia River Gorge
properties.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 17 at 2:46PM PST until January 18 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant icing expected. Total snow accumulations of 1
to 3 inches. Ice accumulations will vary depending on location
within the Gorge. Little if any ice accumulations is expected
near the west end, with a tenth to a quarter of an inch between
Rooster Rock and Multnomah Falls. But, ice accumulations of a
quarter to a half inch are expected from Multnomah Falls to the
Cascade Locks and Stevenson.

* WHERE...In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. In
Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 8 AM Saturday. Time of
heaviest ice accumulations between 1 am and 6 am Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the
ice. Travel will be very treacherous, and could be nearly
impossible. Avoid unnecessary travel through the Columbia River
Gorge tonight into Saturday morning.
properties.instruction:
Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency. Prepare for possible power outages.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM SATURDAY
